ARABIC: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: a spring from which Allah's slaves will drink, making it gush forth at will abundantly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: From a spring of which the votaries of God will drink and make it flow in abundance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This will be a gushing spring wherefrom Allah's servants shall drink wine, a spring from which they will take out channels wherever they wish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: which flows from a spring from which the servants of God will drink.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The Kafoor is a spring, from which the chosen bondmen of Allah will drink, causing it to flow wherever they wish inside their palaces.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: A spring wherefrom the servants of Allah will drink, causing it to gush forth abundantly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A fountain from which the servants of Allah shall drink; they make it to flow a (goodly) flowing forth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: a fountain whereat drink the servants of God, making it to gush forth plenteously.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A spring wherefrom the slaves of Allah drink, making it gush forth abundantly,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: a spring from which God's servants will drink, making it gush forth in branches.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: From a fountain whence the bondmen of Allah will drink, causing it to gush abundantly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: a spring where Allah’s servants will drink, making it gush forth as they please.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: A Fountain where the Devotees of Allah do drink, making it flow in unstinted abundance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: A spring wherefrom the slaves of Allah will drink, causing it to gush forth abundantly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: a fountain at which the worshipers of Allah drink and make it gush forth abundantly;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A spring from which the servants of God will drink, making it gush abundantly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allah will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:6] a spring (‘aynan substitutes for kāfūran), containing the scent thereof, from which the servants of God, His friends, drink, making it gush forth plenteously, directing it to wherever they wish of their dwellings.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: A spring wherefrom the slaves of Allah) the friends of Allah (drink, making it gush forth abundantly) whenever they wish, from the Garden into their own habitations and palaces; it is also said that this means: they make it into a mixture;
